content.webTitle: In praise of … snowball fights | Editorial

fields.headline: In praise of … snowball fights
fields.bodyText: Long before any manager ever came up with away days as a means of releasing steam within a team, nature provided everybody living in colder parts of the planet with everything they needed to pelt one another in the spirit of playfulness. A modest sprinkling of the white stuff is enough to stir children into an exchange of icy missiles. But to overcome adult inhibitions about snowballing, you need a real blizzard. That is what Washington DC has been engulfed by this week, scuppering much supposedly important business and freeing the odd important professional to forget all about it, and do what they please instead. Against a backdrop of the United States Congress – what better location? – an almost-wholly grown-up crowd was filmed hurling snowballs at each other, and having the time of their lives. After this wet but mild British winter, here's hoping that next year gives us the chance to do the same.
